lines.text: [Ernest is getting his shots and is in pain]
I did it! I took the Lindbergh baby! I am 'Josef Mengele' qv! AAAHHH!
Okay, one more chance, but your boys better get with the program. Know what I mean?
Oh I know what you mean, sir, thank you.
And that was the ritual of the Blade, the Stone, and the Arrow.
Paper, Rock, Scissors.
One monkey don't stop no show.
You're gonna learn to swim the Stennis way.
All aboard that's going ashore!
[the camp sign falls on Ernest]
What happened?
Ernest broke the sign.
Well, at least nobody was hurt.
Have you ever held a leadership position?
I had a ant farm once.
Somethin' burnin'? Ayyy-EWW!
No. I-I can't eat on an empty stomach.
And then, he thought he heard it, and that's when Vernon turned around and looked in his rear window... and there, staring back at him was the hook man!
[laughs sinsterly]
So, he stomps on the gas, and he tore out of there, and the next day, Vernon went to get in his car, and there, hanging on the rear view mirror, was the hook!
I thought it was supposed to be on the door handle.
Well yeah it was, but then Vernon hung it on the rear view mirror like dice and baby shoes.
My motto is, "I never met a bad kid."
Then let me introduce you to some. These misfits were selected by their ward leaders as most in need of help.
[they step over to the boys]
This here's the ringleader, Bobby Wayne. He's been in and out of institutions like this since he was eleven.
Since I was nine.
And this here's Crutchfield. Twelve years old and already a master thief.

[Hands back Ernest's wallet]
It's like a... gift or something.
Well, thanks
[takes the wallet]
And here's Danny Simpson. He comes from a long line of troublemakers.
It's a family tradition. I've got a reputation to uphold.
And the Albert Eeeeiiinstein of this institution, Chip Ooooozgood.
[Says nothing]

[Shakes her head]
Butch Too Cool Vargas.
[Says nothing, looks at her contemptuously]
You will have great wealth if you let these men own the land.
[Chief responds]

He says, who can own a tree? Who can own a rock? Only the Great Spirit. Mister Black, these grounds are the homes to our ancient Indian ceremonial grounds, my grandfather and I are the last of our tribe.
That sure was some rap Chief was putting on for us.
Do you think it's true?
Well you wouldn't catch me standing around letting some Indian throw knives at me.
Whack!
You see these hands? Huh? Huh? You see them? If I put them in my pockets I will be arrested for concealing lethal weapons.
They're still in there!
Sherman, can't we possibly give these people just a little more time?
Do they have any legal right to be there?
Technically, no.
Then get rid of them.
Ernest, um... we've been thinking.
Yeah, we ain't got much of a chance but we got a plan.
If we stop those miners then there will be a Camp Kikakee.
Boys, we can't stop those miners, look what they did to me and that was just one of them.
Come on Ernest, that don't sound like no path of the brave to me.
I don't want to go back to no institution, I want to stay right here with you.
Yeah we all do, Ernest.
Come on, Ernest, we can get them.
Hey, it's the path of the brave.
Let's go for it, we can do it, Ernest.

[Jake is trying to get Ernest to eat his food]
Eddie? It's time for the plane to go to hangar!
[Krader has come to kill Ernest with his rifle. He points his rifle at Ernest and has him dead in the crosshairs]

[v.o]
If he had faith in The Great One, the knife would not cut him.
[Krader fires and inexplicably misses, much his his own and Ernest's surprise. He moves closer and aims again]

[v.o]
If he had courage; *true* courage, the rock would not break him.
[Krader fires again and misses. He moves closer and targets Ernest again]

[v.o]
If the brave was pure of heart, the arrow could not catch him.
[Krader fires and misses. He moves to point-blank range and takes aim. Ernest plugs the rifle barrel with his finger and smirks]

[smugly]
Paper, rock scissors.
